articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: IT WAS tantrum o’clock as a petulant Philippe Clement followed his petted lip down the tunnel only moments after the shrill of Matthew MacDermid’s whistle had brought the action to a conclusion in Dingwall. There was no semblance of the traditional handshake with the opposition manager as the Belgian peevishly ignored Don Cowie while displaying [...]

articles.description: Anyone can win when you are miles ahead and there is no pressure on, but winning when you can feel an opponent’s breath on your neck is far more challenging.  Celtic dealt admirably with the pressure on Saturday. If anything, the wind was worse than at Ibrox six days earlier.  Playing against the breeze in [...]
articles.title: Stressed out Clement flips title race to Celtic

articles.description: JOE HART admits he is going into the unknown as he prepares to call a halt to his eventful 20-year career. articles.description: CELTIC overwhelmed the highly-acclaimed Leeds United 2-1 in a the second leg of an unforgettable European Cup semi-final – EXACTLY 54 years ago. Davie Hay played that phenomenal evening and, in another CQN EXCLUSIVE,  the Hoops legend spoke extensively about the confrontation [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC were forced to play TWO games in the ONE day as they clinched their thirteenth league title back in 1916. It was on this day, exactly 108 years ago, Willie Maley’s proud Bhoys lifted the flag in the most bizarre of situations. The heroic tale is told by author Alex Gordon in his fifteenth [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine

Author Alex Gordon was a long-time friend of the [...]

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
The dust has settled on last weekend’s game v the rangers at Ibrox. With no ticket allocation for away fans, it was pubs and clubs around the globe that were packed with Celtic fans. Publicans everywhere rubbing their hands with plenty of hangovers to be nursed at work on Monday after overindulging on Sunday. […]
The post WHEN SATURDAY COMES appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: WHEN SATURDAY COMES
